Dating: NAQADA I (not before); NAQADA; NAQADA II (not after)
Name: Figurine in ivory
Description: This ivory figurine, which dates from the Naqada I-II Period, depicts a human silhouette. The face is triangular in shape and the hair is depicted by several indentations. The holes for the eyes were originally inlaid. There are also several score marks on the upper part of the body but their meaning is obscure. The large notch at the bottom could indicate that the figurine was used as a kind of pendant.
